name: Silver bromide
desc: Silver bromide (AgBr), a soft, pale-yellow, water-insoluble salt well known (along with other silver halides) for its unusual sensitivity to light. This property has allowed silver halides to become the basis of modern photographic materials. AgBr is widely used in photographic films and is believed by some to have been used for making the Shroud of Turin. The salt can be found naturally as the mineral bromargyrite (bromyrite).
Solubility:
insoluble in alcohol, most acids
sparingly soluble in ammonia
soluble in alkali cyanide solutions
Other anions:
Silver(I) fluoride
Silver chloride
Silver iodide
